newsitem.title: UK: UK's Major wants tax cuts in budget - newspaper.
newsitem.headline: UK's Major wants tax cuts in budget - newspaper.

text.p: The Financial Times newspaper reported that British Prime Minister John Major wanted a package of tax cuts in the November 26 budget, including a reduction in the basic rate of income tax to 23 percent from 24 percent.
"The PM does not see how we can go into the election claiming that the economy is in superb shape if we have failed to cut taxes," it quoted an unnamed senior member of the government as saying.
Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke said recently that voters would be "deeply suspicious" of pre-election tax cuts.

The Financial Times reported Major was concerned at Clarke's "downbeat message" on tax and wanted a cut in the basic rate, a rise in the number of people paying the basic 20 percent tax rate and a rise in the threshold for inheritance tax.
It estimated the cost of such a package at around three billion stg.
